titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joseph Tucker, Indictment
CWG9891

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky Grayson Circuit Court
Commonwealth Plaintiff
against } on a charge of Perjury
Joseph Tucker Defendant

Joseph Tucker being in custody charged with the offence of perjury and being admitted to bail in the sum of five hundred Dollars now we James Tucker Finis E Williams & Henry Tucker of Breckenridge County Ky hereby undertake that the above named Joseph Tucker will appear in the Grayson Circuit Court on the first day of its next May Term to answer said charge and will at all times render himself amenable to the orders and process of said Court in the prosecution of said charge and if convicted will render himself in Execution thereof, or if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions that we will pay the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of Five hundred Dollars, Witness our hands this this 7th day of January 1861

Joseph ^his X mark^ Tucker
James ^his X mark^ Tucker
Finis E, Williams
Henry ^his X mark^ Tucker

A Copy attest
Edwin Thomas C, G, C, C

State of Kentucky Grayson Circuit Court
May Term 1861
Commonwealth Plaintiff
against } on Indictment for perjury
Joseph Tucker Defendant

This day came the Attorney for the commonwealth, and the Defendant being bound by recogniseance to appear here this day, And not appearing altho solemnly called. It is adjudged by the court that his recognizance be forfeited, and that a
Summons issue against the Defendant and his securities to appear here on the 1st day of the next Term of this court to show cause why Judgment should not be rendred against them for $500 the amount of the recognizance
A Copy attest Edwin Thomas C, G, C, C
